author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Saraswati Mahal Library and Research Centre here has been provided with a new printing machine at an expenditure of Rs. 25 lakh.

N. Subbaiyan, District Collector, inaugurated the press by pressing a button for printing a few sheets at a function held on the Library campus on Saturday.

The Collector said that the press has a variety of facilities. Its per minute capacity is 220 pages for scanning and 110 pages for printing.

The Library has so far brought out 600 books in the past decades. The press would facilitate re-printing of the old editions, he added. N. M. Mayilvahanan, Superintendent of Police, was present. S. Sudharsan, Librarian, Manimaran, Tamil Pandit and Sivakumar, Curator were present.
title: New printing press inaugurated
